newsitem.title: USA: Crown Cork sells unit to management.
newsitem.headline: Crown Cork sells unit to management.

text.p: Crown Cork & Seal Co Inc said on Wednesday it sold its Crown-Simplimatic business to a group of investors, including division management, led by Key Equity Capital Corp of Cleveland, Ohio, for $105 million.

The selling price of $105 million includes $90 million in cash and $15 million of eight percent class A preferred stock that is convertible into approximately 20 percent of the common stock of Crown-Simplimatic, the company said.
Crown Cork & Seal will have one representative on the seven member board of directors, the company said.
Cash proceeds from the sale will be used to reduce short-term indebtedness, Crown Cork said.

Crown-Simplimatic was formed in early 1996 by combining Crown Cork & Seal's former Machinery Division with the Simplimatic Engineering business of Crown's CarnaudMetalbox subsidiary, the company said.
The combination created one of only a handful of global, turnkey, beer and beverage filling line providers, the company said.
In 1996, Crown-Simplimatic represented approximately two percent of Crown Cork & Seal's consolidated net sales of $8.3 billion.
